thread.title: Cyclist Dies After Lorry Collision in North Dublin
thread.title_full: Cyclist Dies After Lorry Collision in North Dublin

author: newsdirectory3
title: Cyclist Dies After Lorry Collision in North Dublin
text:
Cyclist ​Killed in dublin Collision, Police ​Seek‌ Witnesses Dublin, Ireland – A cyclist in his‌ 50s tragically lost his life after‌ being struck by a ‍lorry ​in north Dublin on Tuesday afternoon.The incident occured around 4:30 p.m. at the junction of College Road and Castleknock Village.
The cyclist’s body was transported to the mortuary at Connolly Hospital Blanchardstown, where a⁤ post-mortem examination will be conducted.
Following the ⁢collision, the Castleknock Road through Castleknock⁤ Village was ‍temporarily closed to allow for a technical examination of the scene. The road has since reopened to traffic.
Authorities are⁤ urging anyone who ⁤may have witnessed the collision‌ to come forward with information. Gardaí are especially interested in speaking with any‍ road ⁢users who may have‌ dashcam ​footage from the area at the time of⁤ the incident.
Anyone with‍ information is⁤ asked to contact Blanchardstown Garda Station at 01 ⁣666 7000, the Garda Confidential Line at 1800 666 111,⁤ or any Garda station.
Cyclist ⁣Fatality Prompts‍ Witness Appeal⁢ in North Dublin Dublin, ⁤Ireland – NewsDirectory3.com spoke ⁢with road safety expert, Sarah O’Connell, following the tragic death of a​ cyclist ⁤in north Dublin. ​Ms. O’Connell expressed her deep condolences to the victimS family and highlighted⁣ the urgency of the Gardaí’s appeal ⁢for witnesses.
“Every road fatality is ⁣a tragedy, ‍and it’s vital that we understand ⁤the ​circumstances surrounding this incident,” Ms. O’Connell stated. “The Gardaí are right to seek out any‌ available evidence, particularly dashcam footage, which ⁤can ⁢provide critical ⁤insights into the moments leading up ⁢to the collision.”
Ms. O’Connell emphasized the importance‌ of road ⁣user vigilance, particularly ⁣in areas with heavy traffic. “Drivers and cyclists alike need‌ to⁣ be ⁣extra cautious at ⁢junctions​ and ⁢intersections, where visibility can be limited. We all share a responsibility to prioritize safety ⁣on the roads.” ‍
The ‌investigation into the collision is ongoing, and Ms. O’Connell urged anyone with facts to come ⁣forward. ” Even seemingly​ minor details could be crucial in piecing together what ‍happened.​ Your cooperation could help prevent future ⁢tragedies.”
